intro: Nicotiana tuberculata, commonly known as the woolly nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are usually pale purple to white, with five petals and a distinctive, tuberculate (bumpy) appearance. It is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in temperate climates.
